learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate the psychological implications of contemporary issues by integrating theoretical frameworks and current research.
Critically assess relevant ethical dilemmas and societal challenges, proposing evidence-based strategies to address these issues.
Design, articulate, and defend psychological research relevant to the selected theme, utilising appropriate tools and methodologies.
Synthesise knowledge across disciplines to anticipate future trends and their potential psychological effects, fostering innovative and socially responsible solutions.

assessments.task_description: In this research proposal assignment, you will have the opportunity to explore a topic covered in the course related to the psychology of technology in depth. Your task is to develop a 2500-word research proposal that adheres to the guidelines and standards of the American Psychological Association (APA) style, 7th Edition. This proposal should present a well-structured rationale based on a literature review, outline your proposed study, make predictions, and include a reference list (which is not included in the word count). Additionally, you should create a budget for the study, with a maximum (realistic) budget allocation of AUD$3500. NOTE: You will provide a 3-minute video overview of your proposal during Week 9, and you will be provided feedback about your project based on that. Your final written proposal should show evidence that you have taken this feedback on board.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students will provide a brief (3-minute) presentation about their research proposal as a YouTube video. The video should clearly establish the background of the project, the hypotheses tested, and the proposed methods and predictions, among other essential criteria. You must upload your video and email the video's link (to Prof Vanman) by the due date. Failure to send the link to a working video on time will result in a late penalty of 10% of the maximum mark for each day that the submission goes past the scheduled date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You will need to upload your video to YouTube and then provide a link (unlisted or public) to it.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final exam will be given during the exam block and administered centrally. It will consist of six (6) short essay questions. These questions will require you to integrate information you have learned from the assigned readings, videos, and lectures. Some will focus on ethical and practical considerations of our covered topics. Others will ask you to integrate two completely different topics in your answer (e.g., VR and robots). Practice exam questions will be provided by May 1 on Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: Lecture Reflections. At 11 lectures (i.e., all lecture meetings but the first), you will be asked a question at the beginning of class and a second one during another part of the lecture. You will receive one mark for each answer if it shows evidence that you were prepared for or attended the lecture.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
